channel.title: Best gaming computer
channel.description:
I'm looking for a nice gaming computer, I don't really do anything else on the computer but games and homework. My dad's cheap as fuck and decides that a 1gb dell desktop is good, but that's bullshit, i don't want a fucking 1gb desktop . Need some advice, please before i smack my dad.
Edit: I'm terrible with computers.

item.title: Best gaming computer
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Building a computer isn’t that hard.

It’s a bit like Legos.

You just make sure that parts are compatible(make adjustments as necessary), and plug them in.

Read full topic

item.title: Best gaming computer
item.dc:creator: @Jerico_Pimpinbro Jerico Pimpinbro
item.description:
@Jerico_Pimpinbro wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:14, topic:400446”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=497521.msg3638291#msg3638291 date=1308763203]

Alienware is overpriced, but good. If price isn’t a concern I’d get an Alienware. Other than that, try building your own.

inb4linux

Alien wear USE to be one of the best, now they just have a bunch of flashy shit to make it look cool cause their computers are outdated and over priced.
[/quote]

Alienware were never the best.

Just invest a little time learning about how to build a computer (and I mean, it is a little time) and get one much cheaper for better peformance, better warranties and most of the time, better quality components.

It isn’t hard, just get someone to verify the components and you’ll be fine. It is just like playing with expensive lego.[/quote]

Alienware is like Apple. You’re basically purchasing it for the brand name.

Read full topic

item.title: Best gaming computer
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Personally I bought this gaming laptop from Asus. Have yet to make it lag without performing a stress test on the CPU.

amazon.com

Amazon.com: ASUS G73JW-A1 Republic of Gamers 17.3-Inch Gaming Laptop (Black): Computers & Accessories

17.3" FHD (1920x1080) (LED)/Intel Core i7-740QM (1.73GHz Quad-Core)/8GB DDR3 RAM/NVidia GTX 460M 1.5G GDDR5 VRAM/1TB HDD (500G x 2 7200RPM)/BD Combo Drive/Illuminated Keyboard/Windows 7 Home Premium ( ...

Alienware is overpriced, but good. If price isn’t a concern I’d get an Alienware. Other than that, try building your own.

inb4linux
[/quote]
Alien wear USE to be one of the best, now they just have a bunch of flashy shit to make it look cool cause their computers are outdated and over priced.[/quote]

Alienware were never the best.

Just invest a little time learning about how to build a computer (and I mean, it is a little time) and get one much cheaper for better peformance, better warranties and most of the time, better quality components.

It isn’t hard, just get someone to verify the components and you’ll be fine. It is just like playing with expensive lego.

@someone2 wrote:

I know the best gaming laptop. Falcon Northwest, take a look.

2 NVideas, newest and best ones. Don’t remember name.
Best cooling
